title: Scene 2: Restraint Room
text:
You barely speak above a whisper. Your body is cold. Your mouth is dry. You still haven't seen a doctor. Asking questions is considered aggressive. Crying too loud is considered a threat.

You approach the nurse’s station again to ask about food, or your meds, or anything—just something to anchor you to a timeline.

A tech blocks your path. He’s built like a fridge, tattoos coiling up his neck. He says nothing. Just points at a sign: *'Staff Only Past This Point.'*

You back away. You feel nauseous. You reach for the trash can.

He grabs your hair and drags you toward the bathroom. You're too stunned to resist. He shoves your head over a toilet. It’s not clean.

Later, you’re told you were ‘disruptive.’ You're stripped of your clothing again and placed in the restraint room. Three-point. Padded table. Soundproof walls. And before the door shuts, someone whispers in your ear: *“You’ll be here forever.”*

choices.text: Shut down completely. No more crying. No more talking.
choices.result: They call you 'quiet and cooperative' in the next shift handoff.

choices.text: Plead with the tech to please tell someone what happened.
choices.result: You're told to 'watch your tone' or the restraints will come back.

choices.text: Snap. Shout that this is abuse. Demand a lawyer.
choices.result: Security is called. You're sedated before you can finish your sentence.
